definition: Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
week/weekly/variant of 周[zhou1]
favor/grace/kindness
variant of 恩[en1]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来总理毕生为中国革命鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: Our beloved Premier Zhou Enlai is the outstanding representative of this area.
sentences.chinese: 我们敬爱的周恩来总理就是这方面的杰出代表。

sentences.english: Comrade Zhou Enlai was in a very difficult position at the time of the 1971 National Conference on Education.
sentences.chinese: 一九七一年全教会时，周恩来同志处境很困难。

sentences.english: Zhou was the consummate diplomat, but also a considerable wit.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来是个完美的外交家，也同时是位智者。

sentences.english: I stood not far away from Premier Chou Enlai.
sentences.chinese: 我站在周恩来的不远处。

sentences.english: The core of Zhou En-lai's spirit is to serve the people.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来精神的核心是全心全意为人民服务。

sentences.english: Good-neighbor policy is one of the important parts of Zhou Enlai foreign thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 睦邻外交是周恩来外交思想的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: All life of Zhou Enlai, there are a lot of time is spent in negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来的一生，有许多时间是在谈判桌上度过的。

sentences.english: Comrade Zhou Enlai finally departed from us.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来同志和我们永别了。

sentences.english: I turned around and had a look. Oh – it was Zhou Enlai.

definition: Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Chairman Mao/Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 (1893-1976), Chinese Communist leader
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Deng Yingchao (1904-1992), Chinese communist leader, wife of Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
